page.title: 03Decline of industry
page.content: Formerly the areas of Wrose, Windhill and Shipley being covered by the Domesday Project were primarily industrial. The wool textile industry was predominant but quarrying brick making and light engineering provided important local centres of employment. Over the past 30 years these industries have ceased to exist in the survey area and in their places parkland, open spaces recreational areas have been developed. The tall factory chimneys which once belched out black smoke over their surroundings have long since disappeared and the air is fresh once again. The Leeds and Liverpool Canal once an important industrial waterway carrying raw materials and finished goods to and from the mills now attracts pleasure barges. Anglers and joggers use the banks of canal & river
